channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Michigan voters share their views on Biden
item.description: Michigan Democrats are divided on how President Biden's recent debate performance will affect him. The unprecedented matchup between Biden and Donald Trump scramble any efforts to make forecasts.
item.content:encoded: Michigan Democrats are divided on how President Biden's recent debate performance will affect him. The unprecedented matchup between Biden and Donald Trump scramble any efforts to make forecasts.
item.dc:creator: Rick Pluta

item.title: Republicans are trying to lose by less in key blue areas in Wisconsin
item.description: A state won by razor thin margins in the last two elections, Republicans are hoping they can "lose by less" in key areas that will help them flip the state back to red.
item.content:encoded: A state won by razor thin margins in the last two elections, Republicans are hoping they can "lose by less" in key areas that will help them flip the state back to red.
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: Marathon Oil reaches a $241 million settlement with EPA for environmental violations
item.description: The federal government announced a settlement with Marathon Oil for alleged air quality violations at the company's oil and gas operations on the Fort Berthold Indian Reservation in North Dakota.
item.content:encoded:
The federal government announced a settlement with Marathon Oil for alleged air quality violations at the company's oil and gas operations on the Fort Berthold Indian Reservation in North Dakota.

(Image credit: Matt Brown)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How leaders at NATO summit are responding to Hungarian prime minister's Moscow visit
item.description: Hungary’s Prime Minister Viktor Orban arrived at the NATO summit in Washington after a controversial trip to Russia and China, and he’s planning to visit former President Trump in Florida.
item.content:encoded: Hungary’s Prime Minister Viktor Orban arrived at the NATO summit in Washington after a controversial trip to Russia and China, and he’s planning to visit former President Trump in Florida.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Lower gas prices helped inflation cool in June
item.description: Inflation fell in June, as a drop in gasoline prices more than offset the modest monthly rise in rent. This could help clear the way for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates in September.
item.content:encoded: Inflation fell in June, as a drop in gasoline prices more than offset the modest monthly rise in rent. This could help clear the way for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates in September.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: This week in science: swimming lions, the 'glass' skin craze and a rotten egg planet
item.description: NPR's Short Wave brings stories of lion brothers making a record-breaking swim in Uganda, the skincare trend among pre-teens that is worrying dermatologists, and a planet that smells like rotten eggs.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Short Wave brings stories of lion brothers making a record-breaking swim in Uganda, the skincare trend among pre-teens that is worrying dermatologists, and a planet that smells like rotten eggs.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: Trump is distancing himself from Project 2025, but some in his circle have ties to it
item.description: Former President Trump and his campaign are working hard to disavow ties to Project 2025, the sweeping conservative plan led by the Heritage Foundation that seeks to transform the American government.
item.content:encoded: Former President Trump and his campaign are working hard to disavow ties to Project 2025, the sweeping conservative plan led by the Heritage Foundation that seeks to transform the American government.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Boxes holding Narcan in overdose hotspots can save lives, Massachusetts project shows
item.description: There’s no single reason for the slight drop in opioid overdose deaths across most of the U.S. last year. But finding new ways to make Narcan available in public, 24 hours a day, is helping.
item.content:encoded: There’s no single reason for the slight drop in opioid overdose deaths across most of the U.S. last year. But finding new ways to make Narcan available in public, 24 hours a day, is helping.
item.dc:creator: Martha Bebinger

item.title: Congress passes a bill to bring new oversight to the troubled federal prison system
item.description: The Senate has overwhelmingly passed a landmark bill to bring more oversight to federal prisons. The legislation will soon head to the White House, for a signature from President Biden.
item.content:encoded: The Senate has overwhelmingly passed a landmark bill to bring more oversight to federal prisons. The legislation will soon head to the White House, for a signature from President Biden.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Thousands of Philadelphia city workers are fighting a 5-day office week mandate
item.description: The City of Philadelphia ordered all city workers to return to the office five days a week starting July 15. A judge has heard arguments as part of a union request to delay implementation.
item.content:encoded: The City of Philadelphia ordered all city workers to return to the office five days a week starting July 15. A judge has heard arguments as part of a union request to delay implementation.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu
